page.title: 03Farming Practices in Rutland
page.content:
Cultivation on Rutland farms is highly mechanised and technical, with the usage of fertilizer and pesticide being carefully calculated to allow optimum benefit. Chemical fertilizers are widely used because of their convenience, but manure is also popular as many farmers appreciate the way it benefits soil structure. Farmers may treat certain crops in a particular way to meet specific customer requirements.
Machines include tractors, muck spreaders, chemical sprayers, harrows, seed drills and combine harvesters. Most farmers are adept at the repair, maintenance and modification of machinery. Members of the family usually supply labour on each farm.
